articles.title: Ancient helium leaking from core offers clues of Earth's formation - Phys.org
articles.description: Helium-3, a rare isotope of helium gas, is leaking out of Earth's core, a new study reports. Because almost all helium-3 is from the Big Bang, the gas leak adds evidence that Earth formed inside a solar nebula, which has long been debated.
